page.title: 19Royal Norfolk Showground
page.content: The showground comprises of{630 acres of{fields and woodland.}Over the years it has gradually{expanded}as more people have been able to travel to the show.}The first president of the{Royal {Norfolk Agricultural Association, which deals with the Show, was named in{1847.}The show itself has{changed {greatly}since then, although it has always been a{commercial}and educational show.The{90 acres}which it covers are filled with trade stands for{farming machinery, local crafts {and produce, also cars,}and more recently things like{double glazing {and insurance. The show became the{'Royal'}Show in 1908. The title was given by{King {Edward VII.}The Agricultural Association was and always had been a {self supportive}charity with the highlight on education and industry.
